publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3565# Mr John Swinney: A9 - Perth to Inverness-That the Parliament notes with concern the unacceptable level of death and injury caused by road traffic accidents on the A9 from Perth to Inverness; recognises that the design of the A9, particularly the frequent switching between single and dual carriageway, contributes to this level of danger; welcomes improvements made to the road design to improve safety, particularly measures already agreed at the Bankfoot and Ballinluig junctions, but recognises that, until the A9 from Perth to Inverness is re-constructed as a dual carriageway with safe junctions, it will continue to present road safety dangers to the local community and the significant number of visitors to the area. Supported by: Kay Ullrich*, Brian Adam*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Kate Maclean*, Colin Campbell*, Stewart Stevenson*, Michael Russell*, Irene McGugan*, Ms Sandra White*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Richard Lochhead*, Murdo Fraser*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Tricia Marwick*
